cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 375 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking quickly west toward the south-Texas coast with inland motion into northern Mexico after landfall
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast near the Mouth of the Rio Grande–Port Mansfield area

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-Texas coastline including Baffin Bay, Corpus Christi Bay and Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm conditions possible with sustained winds near 35–40 mph and higher gusts Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 1–3 ft possible in Corpus Christi Bay and adjacent coastal areas
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals to 7 inches could cause flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes Tuesday
